data.name: index_contact
data.value: Contact:

data.name: index_info_text_1
data.value: Trust and credibility play a central role for the FHNW. For this reason, the FHNW as well as its employees always aim for complete compliance with the law. Nevertheless, violations of the law in individual cases cannot be completely ruled out.

data.name: index_info_text_2
data.value: Do you have a hint of irregularities, acts of corruption or other illegal activities? We offer you the opportunity to report suspected misconduct on this website.

data.name: index_info_text_3
data.value: This web-based reporting site ensures anonymity and protected handling of the data received. The report can be submitted either completely anonymously or by providing your name. Neither the technical team nor the support team of the website will be able to identify you in any way.

data.name: index_info_text_4
data.value: In addition, after submitting your report, you will have the opportunity to interact anonymously with our professionals. All information and conversations will be kept confidential.

data.name: index_info_text_5
data.value: Please ensure that you do not use the infrastructure provided by your organization (such as PC, tablet, mobile device) when submitting anonymous reports. To submit a report, read the FAQs and instructions carefully to ensure the greatest possible protection of your identity.

data.name: index_info_text_6
data.value: All further details on the use of the reporting system can be found in the instructions. If you have any questions about reporting, please refer to the FAQs.

data.name: index_info_text_7
data.value: Thank you for submitting such important information! Only if we have this information, we can take actions.

data.name: manual_title
data.value: Manual

data.name: faq_title
data.value: FAQs

data.name: securitynotice_title
data.value: Security notice

data.name: securitynotice_subtitle
data.value: Our reporting system provides technical protection for your identity and the content you submit.

data.name: securitynotice_list_title
data.value: To further enhance your security, please note the following points:

data.name: securitynotice_list_item_1
data.value: Our website is separate from our organizations IT environment

data.name: securitynotice_list_item_2
data.value: If you wish to remain anonymous, do not include any personal information in your report. Avoid data that could be used to identify you individually

data.name: securitynotice_list_item_3
data.value: Do not use a device provided by your organization to report your case

data.name: securitynotice_list_item_4
data.value: We ensure that reporting metadata is not stored in any way

data.name: securitynotice_checkbox_title
data.value: To enter your report, you must agree to these security notices.

data.name: securitynotice_checkbox_text
data.value: I agree with the security instructions

data.name: securitynotice_continue
data.value: Continue

data.name: upload_text_1

data.name: upload_text_2

data.name: faq_question_1
data.value: What is a whistleblower?

data.name: faq_question_2
data.value: What is the EU-Whistleblower Policy and who does it impact?

data.name: faq_question_3
data.value: What are the deadlines for processing the report?

data.name: faq_question_4
data.value: For which specific cases/misconducts is the whistleblower policy intended?

data.name: faq_question_5
data.value: Why should a wrongdoing be reported?

data.name: faq_question_6
data.value: What information do I need to submit a report?

data.name: faq_question_7
data.value: How is the anonymity of whistleblowers maintained?

data.name: faq_answer_1
data.value: A whistleblower is a person, who has knowledge of wrongdoing within an organization and discloses this information. The wrongdoing may relate to legal violations or unethical behavior. Whistleblowers typically disclose this information by name or anonymously.

data.name: faq_answer_2
data.value: The EU Whistleblower Protection Policy 2019/1937 is an EU guideline that came into force in 2019 through development by the EU Commission and adoption by the EU Council. Its purpose is to protect whistleblowers, who point out wrongdoings in an organization. All organizations with 50 or more employees are required to establish a whistleblower system in their organization. For organizations with 250 or more employees, the expected implementation period is 2 years. For organizations between 50 and 249 employees, the implementation period is extended to an additional 2 years. Switzerland is also facing this major challenge. By the end of 2021, many Swiss organizations in with business partners from the EU region will have to set up a whistleblowing system.

data.name: faq_answer_3
data.value: According to the EU Whistleblowing Guideline, the whistleblower must receive confirmation that his report has been received within seven days. After a further three months at latest, the reporting person must be informed of the status of the its report, what actions have been taken and what the results of these actions are.

data.name: faq_answer_4
data.value: The Whistle-Blower Policy supports reporting against any compliance violations, such as bribery, corruption, privacy, discrimination, harassment, embezzlement, theft, health, safety, environmental, money laundering.

data.name: faq_answer_5
data.value: Whistleblowing is important to promote high ethical standards and thus maintain the trust of employees and the public in an organization. By reporting, you can help prevent a possible escalation of misconduct.

data.name: faq_answer_6
data.value: To enable a thorough investigation of your report, you should describe your case in detail (what exactly happened and when and where it happened). Additionally, you can upload documents and images as evidence for your report via our website.

data.name: faq_answer_7
data.value: The website is based on an independent service that establishes anonymous communication between you and the people who receive the report. Our service is separate from the organization's IT environment. We do not track IP addresses or other data that could identify an individual. Messages can only be decrypted and handled by specific individuals. Your sent metadata is not stored. Advice: We recommend that you access our website from a device that is not connected to the organization's IT environment.

data.name: faq_subtitle_1
data.value: What does whistleblowing mean?

data.name: faq_subtitle_2
data.value: What topics does whistleblowing cover and why should I report them?

data.name: faq_subtitle_3
data.value: How is the Security of my data or information assured?

data.name: disclaimer_infotext
data.value: This page is part of a research project in the field of whistleblowing and blockchain at FHNW. Please do not report real cases here. These will not be processed or forwarded. For real cases, please contact the official «Whistleblower contact of FHNW»:

data.name: disclaimer_whistleblower_contact
data.value: Whistleblower contact of FHNW

data.name: disclaimer_mr
data.value: Mr.

data.name: disclaimer_project_contact
data.value: If you have any questions regarding this project, please contact Dr. Petra Maria Asprion at:

data.name: mainlayout_hello
data.value: Hi,

data.name: manual_1_subtitle
data.value: The most important in a nutshell

data.name: manual_2_subtitle
data.value: Step by step

data.name: manual_3_subtitle
data.value: Submit a report

data.name: manual_4_subtitle
data.value: Submit report

data.name: manual_5_subtitle
data.value: View report

data.name: manual_6_subtitle
data.value: FAQs

data.name: manual_1_listitem_1
data.value: After submitting your report, it is important that you regularly check the submitted report for new messages so that the enterprise can communicate with you. We will ensure that we respond to the report within a week. You can access it with the CaseID and password under «View report».

data.name: manual_1_listitem_2
data.value: If you wish to remain anonymous, do not include any personal information in your report. Avoid data that allows to draw conclusions about your identity.

data.name: manual_1_listitem_3
data.value: Do not use a device provided by your organisation to report your case.

data.name: manual_2_listitem_1
data.value: You can navigate through this menu and select the appropriate option.

data.name: manual_2_listitem_2
data.value: If you want to hide the menubar, you only have to click once on the menu symbol. To show the menu again, click on the same symbol again.

data.name: manual_2_listitem_3
data.value: You can change the language by clicking on the flag in the top right-hand corner.

data.name: manual_2_listitem_4
data.value: You may contact us at any time to clarify any questions or queries you may have regarding whistleblowing. You can contact us at our e-mail address (integrity@inside.ch).

data.name: manual_2_text_1
data.value: On our main page you will see the main menu with four different options on the left side.

data.name: manual_3_text_1
data.value: To submit a report, click on «Submit report». Afterwards, the first thing you will see is the security notice. Please read the security notice carefully. This explains how our team protects your data and how the submitted information will be processed.

data.name: manual_3_text_2
data.value: Please take note of the following:

data.name: manual_3_listitem_1
data.value: You must specifically agree to the security notice to start creating your report.

data.name: manual_3_listitem_2
data.value: If you wish to return to the main page, click on the logo

data.name: manual_3_listitem_3
data.value: To continue your report, click on «Continue» at the bottom right.

data.name: manual_4_text_1
data.value: Please provide the following information:

data.name: manual_4_listtitle_1
data.value: Subject:

data.name: manual_4_listtitle_2
data.value: Describe your case:

data.name: manual_4_listtitle_3
data.value: Provide name:

data.name: manual_4_listitem_1
data.value: In order to assign your report to a specific topic, the first thing you need to do is enter a topic. This field is mandatory and cannot be omitted.

data.name: manual_4_listitem_2
data.value: In order for our team to have as much information as possible about your case, please make sure that you provide us with all relevant information. This field is also considered mandatory.

data.name: manual_4_listitem_3
data.value: We give you the choice of whether or not to include your name. This is optional.

data.name: manual_4_text_2
data.value: To protect your personal information and grant you anonymity, our website is separate from the organisation's IT environment. When entering your report, please make sure that your details do not allow any connections to be drawn to your identity. We also ensure that no metadata of individuals is stored in our database.

data.name: manual_4_text_3
data.value: When you are describing your case, it is helpful to consider the following questions:

data.name: manual_4_text_4
data.value: Once you have filled in all the fields, click on «Continue» at the bottom right.

data.name: manual_4_text_5
data.value: Note:

data.name: manual_4_text_6
data.value: The report cannot be saved temporarily. If a report is filled in, it must also be sent, otherwise the report is not valid.

data.name: manual_4_listitem_4
data.value: Who committed a violation?

data.name: manual_4_listitem_5
data.value: When did it happen?

data.name: manual_4_listitem_6
data.value: Where did it happen?

data.name: manual_4_listitem_7
data.value: How can the incident be substantiated?

data.name: manual_4_listitem_8
data.value: How long have you been aware of the case?

data.name: manual_4_listitem_9
data.value: Are you personally affected by this case?

data.name: manual_4_listitem_10
data.value: Are you already aware of any damage / effects caused by this case?

data.name: manual_4_listitem_11
data.value: Have you reported the case to anyone in the company? If yes, to whom?

data.name: manual_4_text_7
data.value: Next, you have the option to upload documents. Our website supports all file types such as PDF, Docx, CSV and XLSX. The maximum file size is 20 Mb.

data.name: manual_4_text_8
data.value: The uploaded documents are considered as evidence of your submitted report. The evidence is important in order to understand and analyse the situation in your report in detail. This will help us to process your case more effectively and efficiently.

data.name: manual_4_text_9
data.value: To upload the document, drag the document to the upload area. It is also possible to upload multiple documents. Finally, click on «Submit» to submit the report to us. If you want to look at your report again, you can go back to the report form at this point by clicking on «Back».

data.name: manual_4_text_10
data.value: To complete your report, you will receive a CaseID and a defined password from us. The two keys prevent only authorized persons from accessing the report.

data.name: manual_4_text_11
data.value: Please note your CaseID and password immediately. As soon as you close this window, the CaseID and password can no longer be called up or changed.

data.name: manual_5_text_1
data.value: With your CaseID and password, you can call up the current status of your report at any time under «View report».

data.name: manual_5_text_2
data.value: Please enter your CaseID and your password in the two fields and click on «View» in the bottom right-hand corner.

data.name: manual_5_text_3
data.value: If you forget the CaseID or password, they cannot be recovered for security reasons. Alternatively, you can enter a new report and refer to your original report.

data.name: manual_5_text_4
data.value: As soon as you click on «Open», your entered message, the current status and all messages are displayed.

data.name: manual_5_listtitle_1
data.value: The possible states of the report are:

data.name: manual_5_text_5
data.value: Below your report you will find a message function. This function allows you to contact us anonymously.

data.name: manual_5_text_6
data.value: You do not have to enter any additional data to send us a message. Just enter your message in the text field and click on «Send». You will then receive a reply from our team of experts.

data.name: manual_5_text_7
data.value: To view the reply, you must log in again by clicking on «View report». You will not receive a notification from us if there is a new message. This ensures that we cannot draw any conclusions about your identity and that anonymity is guaranteed at all times.

data.name: manual_5_text_8
data.value: Once you have viewed your report, you can click on «Close report» at the bottom right and close the window.

data.name: manual_6_text_1
data.value: FAQ is the abbreviation for Frequently Asked Questions. Under FAQs you will find the compilation of frequently asked questions.

data.name: upload_error_message_size
data.value: The file exceeds the maximum size of 20 megabytes. You can zip the file to reduce the size.
